intro: Aster colensoi, commonly known as Colenso's aster, is a herbaceous perennial native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are blue to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
